content:
I am a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Climate School at Columbia University in the City of New York. I am also a visiting fellow (PhD graduate) at the London School of Economics and Political Science.
My main research interests are climate change and sustainable development. I am particularly interested in the costs of climate change, adaptation to climate change, and in policy instruments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. I am also interested in the the effect of weather and climate on ecological systems and the use and benefits of weather forecasts.
I hold a PhD in Environmental Economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science, where I was affiliated with the Department of Geography and Environment and the Grantham Research Institute on Climate Change and the Environment. I also worked at the International Monetary Fund and the international thinktank adelphi.
In addition to my research and policy advice, I am a passionate teacher of economics and environmental sciences.
